text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with fast and easy creamed spinach
that's right we've done creamed spinach
before but we did the old-school
old-fashioned steakhouse version and
while I do love that version this is a
little easier a little quicker a little
more contemporary and believe it or not
maybe even a little lighter all right so
check it out we're going to start by
wilting some spinach so we're going to
take our largest stock pot or soup
kettle we're gonna put a little bit of
olive oil in the bottom put it on high
heat and dump in a couple pounds of
cleaned spinach it's been picked it's
been rinsed it's been washed there's no
stems or hardly any and did I do any of
that heck no I buy those bags where it's
already prepped for you and so she do
all right so we're gonna dump in the
spinach we're going to quickly throw on
the lid and we're going to let it sit
there for exactly one minute remember
the Heat's on high and after a minute
you're going to take off the lid and
you're just going to start moving it
turn it around and tossing it until it's
completely wilted so that minute cover
just gives you a little head start and
from that point on you can just leave it
uncovered
we're just stirring we're tossing we're
mixing until it all wilts down and looks
like that and be careful while we want
this cooked all the way through we still
want it to stay green so don't go too
far now you'll see here there's still a
couple small leaves that aren't wilted
that's fine those are going to wilt from
the residual heat so when it looks like
that I want you to stop immediately and
I want you to throw into a strainer and
we're going to squeeze out as much of
that hot liquid as possible I'm going to
transfer that to a plate that's been
lined with four or five layers of paper
towel I really want that to wick away
that extra moisture and of course when
it is cool we're gonna gather all that
up and just squeeze out the last of the
liquid because for this version of
creamed spinach liquid is not our friend
all right so while that's cooling down
we're going to go ahead and get our
spice mixture together this is a recipe
where you want to have all your
ingredients all your mise applause done
ahead of time so I'm going to start with
a pinch of salt some cayenne pepper some
freshly grated nutmeg never use the pre
ground if you can help it and you can
help it some freshly ground black pepper
and that's it for the dry spices we're
also going to do some freshly grated
lemon zest it's an awesome way to get
lemon flavor in this without lemon juice
so that's going to work better all right
after the lemon zest last but not least
we're going to mince up some shallot
they say it's somewhere in between a
garlic and an onion that's kind of a
weird description it's very unique you
should try it alright so those are
minced and all our ingredients are now
officially ready so we're going to go
back over to the spinach we're going to
squeeze it really well like as dry as
you can get it once that happens I'm
going to give it a very rough chop on
the cutting board alright we're not
mincing this but you do want to give it
a little bit of a chop so that creamy
sauce mixes in a little more easily and
we are now ready to officially make fast
and easy creamed spinach so when you are
ready to serve go ahead and put a
skillet on medium heat we're going to
add some butter and as soon as it melts
we're going to go ahead and add our
shallot and we're just going to sweat
that in the butter stirring occasionally
with a freakishly small wooden spoon and
we're going to cook that for about three
or four minutes until a just barely
starts to turn golden we don't want it
to brown we just want to kind of turn
translucent and start to sweeten up a
little bit okay so that might take maybe
three or four minutes so right there
mine was looking perfect at that point
we're going to throw in our seasoning
mixture I'm going to give that a quick
mix with the spoon I kind of like when
my seasonings mix in with the hot fat I
always feel like it extracts a little
more flavor who knows and then it's time
for the star of the show cream and by
the way any time I say cream in any of
these videos at home I want you to say
to yourself out loud get the money
dollar dollar bill y'all so we're going
to pour that in we're going to turn the
heat up to medium-high and we're simply
going to reduce that by about half and
when cream reduces and this is why you
can't use skim milk for this when cream
reduces it thickens up and that is going
to be our cream sauce and while it is
true cream has significantly more fat
than milk we're also not using a butter
based ruin this so really it's about the
same calories all right so let it reduce
let it reduce it's going to get thicker
and thicker and you see there that is
looking good so that's about halfway
reduced you can see how that's thickened
up beautifully at this point I want you
to lower your heat down to low we're
going to toss in our spinach and as soon
as that's heated through it's going to
take maybe two minutes you are basically
done okay of course you're going to
taste and adjust for salt and pepper you
knew that though and then one last
optional step and of course as I always
say by optional I mean please do it I
like to toss in a little bit of freshly
grated Reggiano parmesan I think it
gives it a nice finishing touch I've
also done that with a little bit of
sharp cheddar also nice and that's it
give it one last toss and if you're
happy and you know it put it on a plate
as you know this is a classic steak side
dish so I had a little bit of sliced
flank steak left over this went
beautiful with it the lemon by the way
is for the steak not the spinach but
that would be fine I don't judge and
that's it fast and easy creamed spinach
it looks like the old-school traditional
version and it tastes very very similar
but like I said it's just a little
quicker a little easier a little more
contemporary and of course I'm going to
verify that right now so good that
shallot really makes it a little extra
special it's just rich enough it's not
too rich by any means you have that
little subtle hint of lemon so anyway
whether you're looking for something for
a fancy steak dinner or just a side dish
for a regular weeknight meal this is
going to work so I hope you give it a
try head over to food wishes comm for
all the ingredient amounts and more info
as usual and as always enjoy
you
